p: Propolis (“bee glue”, a mixture of the saliva of honey bees with beeswax and plant exudates) contains flavonoids [ 130]. As mentioned above, it has been shown to specifically induce prophages in E. faecalis but not B. thetaiotamicron and S. aureus [ 68]. Brazil is the major producer of propolis and this natural substance can be classified according to its color. Green propolis induced a 3.0 log 10 reduction in the infectivity of MS2 and 3.5 log10 in Av-08; red propolis was even more effective in reducing PFU, with a 4.2 and 4.0 log10 reduction for MS2 and Av-08 [ 96]. The main active molecule of red propolis is formononetin and the suggested mechanism of inhibition was alteration of the structure of the capsid [ 131].
